TopicTitle: Kethane Pack 0.9.2 - New cinematic trailer! - 1.0 compatibility update

Articles.Content:
Are there any plans to make kethane regenerate (naturally and gradually, randomly and suddenly, or in any other fashion) in future versions? Or are we meant to run out eventually?

For now, you're meant to run out. I'm not necessarily against regeneration schemes, but I think if you mine Minmus dry, it's about time you started mining somewhere else.

And regardless of that, what's the best way to make the game re-generate the kethane deposits?

Add "Debug=True" to the Kethane settings.cfg file and start the game. The Kethane window in the map view will have options for regenerating deposits. (These will be getting a makeover in 0.8, but for now they just regenerate all the deposits for all resources at every planet.)

Excuse me please: I'm trying to hack kethane converter so it can take in multiple input resources and multiple output resources, your part.cfg seems to only have sourceresource and targetresource (albeit powerconsumption too) I'm trying to make a ore-->fertilizer-->plants-->food mod so I can bake a pizza on the moon. Please can you explain how the converter code works? Here's a screenshot of all the resources I have: http://i.imgur.com/ghxGzWP.jpg

I don't understand what references sourceresource and targetresource in the source code, there are no references to it anywhere in the .cfg nor in the .cs file here: https://github.com/Majiir/Kethane/blob/master/Plugin/KethaneController.cs

Help?

So much THIS. I can not see a reason to have such pitiful deposits. It should not be possible to launch a single craft from Kerbin which can mine an entire deposit by itself in one go. Generally a deposit would last for a decade or more under heavy extraction. Is it possible to have the min and max deposit sizes set in the cfg or something so we can have heavy and light deposits to more properly suit our individual gameplay? Then you could have deposits that are very small and only suitable for craft carrying up to one kerbal to refuel once, all the way to deposits that can have mining bases running on them for decades or anywhere inbetween. You keep the current gameplay and expand it for all users. Unless of course this is currently possible, I must admit to not checking.

John, considering your launching something that only weighs a few tons and can draw resources that should be thousands of feet down.....

Maybe have some form of slow regeneration rate, say 1 kethane per hour per cell? Assume it seeps up from the lower deposits that would require a full on drilling rig the size of a 2000T rocket.

Is it possible to have the min and max deposit sizes set in the cfg or something so we can have heavy and light deposits to more properly suit our individual gameplay? Then you could have deposits that are very small and only suitable for craft carrying up to one kerbal to refuel once, all the way to deposits that can have mining bases running on them for decades or anywhere inbetween. You keep the current gameplay and expand it for all users. Unless of course this is currently possible, I must admit to not checking.

Absolutely it is possible. If you look in GameData\Kethane\Resources\Kethane.cfg you will find the configuration for the generator, which specifies the max and min amounts per deposit, as well as the deposit count, with the ability to set defaults, and also to adjust them for each individual body in the system.

You'll need to regenerate the Kethane deposits after you edit it, though (either start a new save, delete the node from your SFS file, or use the debug console to regenerate).
